precontext: John had been working at the warehouse for several months. He was in charge of keeping everything in order. Recently, there had been some confusion about inventory.
sentence: Some wood had gone missing from the warehouse, and John was desperately trying to locate the logs.
ending: They are too heavy for one person to take.
meanings_considered: a segment of the trunk of a tree when stripped of branches
a written record of messages sent or received
explanation:
• The precontext about inventory confusion and missing wood makes the meaning of "logs" as pieces of wood highly plausible.  
• The phrase "logs" referring to a written record of inventory would be inconsistent with the context of missing physical wood and the physical handling of items.  
• The ending stating "They are too heavy for one person to take" strongly supports the physical object interpretation, as logs of wood are heavy, not a record.
clear_meaning_text: a segment of the trunk of a tree when stripped of branches
